doc.after: Cooper was formally introduced to his future wife, twenty-year-old New York debutante Veronica Balfe,[Note 9] on Easter Sunday 1933 at a party given by her uncle, art director Cedric Gibbons.[298][299][300] Called "Rocky" by her family and friends, she grew up on Park Avenue and attended finishing schools.[301] Her stepfather was Wall Street tycoon Paul Shields.[301] Cooper and Rocky were quietly married at her parents' Park Avenue residence on December 15, 1933.[302] According to his friends, the marriage had a positive impact on Cooper, who turned away from past indiscretions and took control of his life.[303] Athletic and a lover of the outdoors, Rocky shared many of Cooper's interests, including riding, skiing, and skeet-shooting.[304] She organized their social life, and her wealth and social connections provided Cooper access to New York high society.[305] Cooper and his wife owned homes in the Los Angeles area in Encino (1933â36),[303] Brentwood (1936â53),[303] and Holmby Hills (1954â61),[306] and owned a vacation home in Aspen, Colorado (1949â53).[307][Note 10] Their daughter Maria Veronica Cooper was born on September 15, 1937.[308]
